borrower.value: ALVAREZ & MARSAL CANADA INC., solely in its capacity as Court Appointed Receiver and Manager and Construction Lien Trustee of URBANCORP (LESLIEVILLE) DEVELOPMENTS INC., URBANCORP (RIVERDALE) DEVELOPMENTS INC. and URBANCORP (THE BEACH) DEVELOPMENTS INC.

majority_lenders.value: The Lenders holding at least 66 2/3% of the aggregate amount of Commitments (if no Loans are outstanding) or 66 2/3% of outstanding Loans (if Loans are outstanding), or both Lenders if there are only two.

lma_defined_term.value: LSTA Model Credit Agreement Provisions (November 1, 2004), as revised under the direction of the Canadian Bankers' Association Secondary Loan Market Specialist Group

disqualified_lender_definition.value: Any natural person, any Obligor, or any Affiliate of an Obligor.

stated_term_of_facility.value: Non-revolving, term credit facility, linked to the Outside Date (June 15, 2018), approximately 14 months from the agreement date.

facility_size_term.value: Cdn. $4,500,000 (allocated between FP Tranche and Development Tranche)

term_loan_commitments.value: Cdn. $4,500,000 (allocated between FP Tranche and Development Tranche)

repayment_provision.value: Mandatory repayment upon acceleration after an Event of Default; otherwise, repayment is solely from 'Proceeds for Distribution' (Gross Sale Proceeds from Units, sales/rental income from Beach Remaining Lands, Leslieville Project, and other property of UC Leslieville, UC Beach, UC Riverdale). ITC Tranche has specific repayment from Canada Revenue Agency receipts.

repayment_type.value: Mandatory Repayment, solely from Proceeds for Distribution

mandatory_repayment.value: Yes, upon acceleration after an Event of Default (Section 5.01(1)) and specific repayment for ITC Tranche (Section 5.01(5))

facility_extension_options.value: Implicitly, the 'Outside Date' (related to facility cancellation) may be extended by agreement of the Required Lenders.

amend_to_extend_clause.value: Yes, the 'Outside Date' can be extended by agreement in writing by the Required Lenders, which would effectively extend the facility term.

lender_discretion.value: Yes, the 'sole and absolute discretion' definition allows discretion to be exercised unreasonably. Used for facility cancellation, application of proceeds, and payment of construction liens.

calculation_of_interest.value: On Prime Rate Loans: Prime Rate plus Prime Rate Margin, calculated on a 365-day calendar year, nominal rate method. Interest accrues after maturity/default/judgment and compounds monthly on overdue interest.

libor_definition.value: Not applicable; facility primarily uses Prime Rate Loans, not LIBOR.

arrangement_fees.value: Deferred Commitment Fee of $200,000, fully earned upon Settlement Approval Order becoming final.

use_of_proceeds.value: For FP Tranche: to finance the Fixed Price payable to Craft under the Craft Construction Contract. For Development Tranche: to finance Budgeted Development Costs in the Initial Development Budget.

restricted_asset_sales_permitted_transfe.value: Construction Receiver will not Dispose of or Lease Leslieville Project or Beach Remaining Lands except for: sales of Units to Opt-In/New Curzon Purchasers (at agreed prices), sales of unallocated parking/storage, sales of Beach Remaining Lands (with Required Lenders' and Court approval), or with prior written consent of Required Lenders.

permitted_indebtedness_basket.value: Debt under this Agreement; Craft Loan (up to $2M, potentially increased for Geo-Thermal or TF Defaulted Cost Overruns); liabilities to Craft under C&D Contracts; Existing Syndicate Debt; Debt under Travelers Agreements/Mortgage; Debt to Terra Firma; additional debt for TF Defaulted Cost Overruns; other Debt to Lenders; liabilities secured by Receiver’s Expense Reimbursement Charge/Borrowings Charge; additional Craft Loans for Geo-Thermal Costs; any other Court-approved Debt.

permitted_financial_indebtedness_text.value: See 'permitted_indebtedness_basket'. Debt includes borrowed money, deferred purchase price, or obligations evidenced by notes, bonds, debentures, or similar instruments.

prepayment_from_asset_sales_proceeds_cla.value: Repayment of Loans and Obligations is made solely from 'Proceeds for Distribution,' which includes Gross Sale Proceeds from Units, and sales proceeds, rental, or other income from the Beach Remaining Lands, Leslieville Project (excluding Units), and other property/assets of UC Leslieville, UC Beach, and UC Riverdale.

percent_of_net_cash_proceeds.value: Not specified as a fixed percentage; distribution is governed by the 'Waterfall' approved under the Settlement Approval Order, after netting the Construction Receiver’s Reserve.

subsidiary_guarantees.value: No explicit subsidiary guarantees. The Construction Receiver's obligations are limited to the proceeds of the property and assets of UC Leslieville, UC Beach, and UC Riverdale, effectively making these entities the source of repayment.

transfer_provisions.value: Lenders may assign all or a portion of rights/obligations to Eligible Assignees or sell participations. Borrower's consent is generally required for assignments, but may be waived if the assignee is already a Lender or an Event of Default has occurred and is continuing.

amendment_clause.value: Requires written agreement executed by Construction Receiver and Administrative Agent (on behalf of Lenders or Required Lenders, depending on the nature of the amendment).

disqualified_lender_list.value: Any natural person, any Obligor, or any Affiliate of an Obligor.

events_of_default.value: Failure to pay any Obligation when due; breach of Section 7.02 covenant (with notice); material breach of other covenants/obligations in Loan Documents (uncured within 30 days, or longer if diligently curing, up to 4 months with Required Lenders' consent); occurrence of a Catastrophic Event; or any event/circumstance preventing a Drawdown under the Credit Facility.

payment_default_provision.value: Yes, failure to pay any Obligation when due constitutes an Event of Default.

insolvency_default.value: Insolvency of Craft, the Builder, or Terra Firma is a condition precedent to Drawdowns. If they become Insolvent, it would effectively prevent Drawdowns and trigger an Event of Default under Section 9.01(5).

market_disruption_clause.value: Yes, if the Required Lenders determine that a market for bankers' acceptances does not exist or Lenders cannot readily sell them, the obligation to make/maintain BA loans is suspended. Also applies if LIBO Rate cannot be determined or does not adequately reflect cost.

no_set_off.value: No, Lenders are authorized to set off and apply deposits/obligations against the Borrower's obligations if an Event of Default has occurred and is continuing. Any benefit from such setoff is shared pro rata among Lenders.

set_off_prohibited_for_borrower.value: Not explicitly prohibited for the Borrower, but the nature of the Construction Receiver's role and payment waterfall (Section 1.09, Section 3.6 of Schedule A) severely limit such rights.

business_days_convention_calendar.value: A day other than Saturday, Sunday or statutory holiday, on which the Administrative Agent is open for business at its executive offices in Toronto, Ontario.

business_days_payments_non_business_day_.value: If a payment day is not a Business Day, payment is due on the next Business Day with interest.

business_days_rate_setting_quotation_day.value: Drawdown Date must be a Business Day. Drawdown Notice required three Business Days prior to Drawdown Date, by 11:00 a.m. (Toronto time).

governing_law.value: Province of Ontario and the laws of Canada applicable in that Province.

confidentiality_clause.value: Yes, Section 14 (Schedule A) outlines confidentiality obligations for the Administrative Agent and Lenders regarding 'Information' received from Obligors, with permitted disclosures.

2.01 
Credit Facility 
(1) 
Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Lenders establish in 
favour of the Construction Receiver a non-revolving, term credit facility (the 
“Credit Facility”) in an amount up to the Credit Facility Commitment which is 
available to the Construction Receiver by way of Prime Rate Loans.  Each 
Lender’s obligation under the Credit Facility is several and limited to the amount 
of its Commitment. 
(2) 
The Credit Facility shall be divided into the FP Tranche and the Development 
Tranche, and if made available by the Lenders, the ITC Tranche, and the Credit 
Facility Commitment shall be allocated between the Tranches by agreement 
between the Construction Receiver and the Administrative Agent, based on the 
advice of the Independent Cost Consultant as of the date of the first Drawdown 
under the Credit Facility; provided that such initial allocation between the

Tranches may be subsequently readjusted or reallocated by further agreement 
between the Construction Receiver and the Administrative Agent upon further 
advice of the Independent Cost Consultant. The Administrative Agent shall 
provide written confirmation to the Construction Receiver and each of the 
Lenders as soon as practicable following such agreed allocation, adjustment or 
reallocation.  
(3) 
If the first advance under the Credit Facility does not occur on or before the First 
Advance Date, the Required Lenders may, in their sole and absolute discretion, 
cancel the Credit Facility, in which event, the Lenders will have no further 
obligation to make Drawdowns available to the Construction Receiver under the

Interest on Prime Rate Loans 
The Construction Receiver will pay interest in Canadian Dollars on each Prime Rate 
Loan from the date of advance to the date of repayment (both before and after default,

payable in accordance with Section 5.01.

interest will accrue from day to day, be payable in arrears and will be calculated on the principal

Lender will determine the payment or payments that are to be reduced or refunded, as the case 
may be, so that such result does not occur.

repayment_provision.value: Clause 8 outlines repayment provisions. Term Loans are repaid in full on their Termination Date. Additional Facility Loans are repaid in instalments or in full on their Termination Date as specified in the Additional Facility Notice. Revolving Facility Loans are repaid on the last day of their Interest Period, with special rules for Rollover Loans.

repayment_type.value: Term Loans are repaid in full. Additional Facility Loans can be repayable in instalments or in full. Revolving Facility Loans are repaid on the last day of their Interest Period and can be reborrowed.

mandatory_repayment.value: Mandatory prepayment obligations arise upon an Exit Event (Change of Control, Sale or Listing resulting in Change of Control), and from Disposal, Insurance and Recovery Proceeds, and IPO Proceeds (under certain Leverage Ratio conditions).

mandatory_prepayment_due_to_change_of_co.value: Upon the occurrence of a Change of Control, a Sale or a Listing which results in a Change of Control (each an 'Exit Event'), each Lender shall be entitled to cancel its Commitments and require repayment of all of its share of the Utilisations and payment of all amounts owing to it under the Finance Documents, by written notice to the Agent within 30 days of the Obligors’ Agent notifying the Agent of the Exit Event.

voluntary_prepayment.value: Borrowers may prepay whole or part of Term Loans (minimum £1,000,000) with 3 Business Days' (Term Rate) or 3 RFR Banking Days' (Compounded Rate) prior notice. Revolving Facility Utilisations can be prepaid with similar notice periods. Any voluntary prepayment of Term Facilities is subject to Clause 9.7 (Revolving Facility Commitment Cap).

call_protection_prepayment_clause.value: If any voluntary prepayment or mandatory prepayment due to an Exit Event (a 'Relevant Prepayment') is made prior to the first anniversary of the Closing Date ('MW End Date'), a prepayment fee equal to the greater of (i) 2% of the Relevant Prepayment Amount and (ii) the Make Whole Amount is payable. If a Relevant Prepayment is made on/from MW End Date but prior to second anniversary, a 2% fee is payable (unless a Further Specified Asset Disposal Refusal occurs). No fee payable on or after second anniversary or for other prepayments (e.g. illegality, asset sales).

facility_extension_options.value: The document refers to 'an extension to the availability or date of payment of or redenomination of any amount under the Finance Documents' as part of a 'Structural Adjustment' which can be subject to amendment/waiver. No specific 'facility extension options' clause is found.

amend_to_extend_clause.value: An 'extension to the availability or date of payment' is listed as a component of a 'Structural Adjustment' in Clause 39.2(a)(i)(A), which requires the consent of the Obligors’ Agent and each Lender participating in that Structural Adjustment (and Majority Lenders if increasing commitments or reducing tenor).

lender_discretion.value: For a 'Structural Adjustment' (which can include an extension), consent is required from the Obligors’ Agent and each Lender participating in that Structural Adjustment. If the Structural Adjustment increases Commitments or reduces tenor, Majority Lenders consent is also required. This indicates discretion for participating and potentially Majority Lenders.

agency_fees.value: The Obligors’ Agent shall pay (or procure there is paid) to the Agent and the Security Agent (in each case for its own account) a fee in the amount and at the times agreed in a Fee Letter.

use_of_proceeds.value: Facility B proceeds are for financing/refinancing the Acquisition consideration, related fees/expenses, and refinancing/acquiring Target Group existing indebtedness (including Existing Debt). Acquisition / Capex Facility proceeds are for financing/refinancing Permitted Acquisitions, Permitted Joint Ventures, capital expenditure of the Group, and funding commitments to funds/vehicles or balance sheet investments. Original Revolving Facility proceeds are for general corporate purposes, working capital requirements, and refinancing financial indebtedness of the Group or acquisition targets. Additional Facility proceeds for purposes agreed with relevant Additional Facility Lenders.

material_adverse_change_clause.value: Any event or circumstance which (after taking into account all mitigating factors including warranties, indemnities or other resources/recourse against third parties and any obligation to provide additional equity investment) has a material effect on: (i) the consolidated business, assets or financial condition of the Group (taken as a whole) (excluding impact on financial covenant ability alone); or (ii) the ability of the Group (taken as a whole) to perform its payment obligations under the Finance Documents; or (iii) subject to Legal Reservations and Perfection Requirements, affects the validity or enforceability of any Finance Documents to a materially adverse extent for Finance Parties (taken as a whole) and is not remedied within 20 Business Days.

interest_coverage_covenant.value: The Company shall ensure that the Debt Service Coverage Ratio for the First Test Date and each Quarter Date thereafter shall not be less than 1.00:1. This covenant is solely for the benefit of, and may only be relied upon by, the Senior Lenders.

interest_coverage_text.value: The ratio of Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA less any change in net working capital, maintenance capex, taxes and deferred consideration plus any net proceeds from Development Projects (and any net proceeds of Balance Sheet Investments, to the extent not already included in Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA) to Consolidated Debt Service.

interest_coverage_tables.value: No specific tables are provided for this covenant.

total_leverage_covenant.value: Senior Lenders benefit from a Leverage Ratio covenant: First Test Date and next 10 Quarter Dates: not exceed 6.75:1. Following 3 Quarter Dates: not exceed 6.50:1. Thereafter: not exceed 6.25:1. Super Senior Lenders benefit from a Leverage Ratio covenant: First Test Date and next 10 Quarter Dates: not exceed 7.50:1. Following 3 Quarter Dates: not exceed 7.22:1. Thereafter: not exceed 6.94:1.

total_leverage_text.value: At the end of a Relevant Period, the ratio of Consolidated Total Net Debt on the last day of that Relevant Period to Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA in respect of that Relevant Period.

total_leverage_tables.value: Refer to the Margin definition for a table showing leverage ratio ranges and corresponding interest margins, which implies monitoring of leverage ratios.

restricted_asset_sales_permitted_transfe.value: Numerous types of disposals are permitted, including: ordinary course of trading, cash/cash equivalents, assets in exchange for comparable/superior assets (with equivalent Security if applicable), intra-group disposals (with equivalent Security if applicable), loss-making/obsolete assets, assets seized/expropriated, leasehold interests/licences, existing contractual arrangements, assets subject to Permitted Factoring or Sale and Leaseback, assets from Permitted Security, intra-Group loan conversions to equity, assets to Permitted Joint Ventures, Treasury Transactions, with Majority Lenders' consent (or Majority Lenders and Majority RCF Lenders for Significant Disposal), by Obligor to Non-Obligor up to Obligor/Non-Obligor Basket, reinvested assets (within certain periods), within Permitted Disposals Basket (£2,750,000 or 7.5% of Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA), intellectual property licences, management/employee share disposals, accounts receivable, special purpose vehicles, competition authority requirements, Balance Sheet Investments (non-DP), Development Projects (non-Third Party IDP), Third Party IDP Disposal, Specified Asset Disposal, shares for employee/management incentive scheme.

permitted_acquisitions_clause_text.value: Numerous types of acquisitions are permitted, including: the Acquisition, acquisition of minority shares in group members, assets from permitted disposals/transactions, cash/cash equivalents, interests in Permitted Joint Ventures, acquisitions complying with specific conditions (e.g., controlling interest, positive EBITDA or expected positive EBITDA within 24 months, not Sanctioned Country, similar business, due diligence for larger acquisitions), pursuant to Permitted Reorganisation/Transaction, Permitted Share Issue, employee/management loan note redemption, intra-Group loan conversion to equity, limited liability entities not traded prior to acquisition close, existing agreements at/after Closing Date, Permitted Investment, as nominee/trustee, with Majority Lenders' consent.

permitted_financial_indebtedness_text.value: Financial Indebtedness permitted includes: under Finance Documents (including Additional Facility), Ancillary Facilities, Permitted Guarantees, Permitted Loans, Permitted Factoring, Permitted Sale and Leaseback, Permitted Finance Lease, Treasury Transactions, Existing Debt (until Clean-up Date), facilities with guarantees/LCs under Ancillary Facilities, with Majority Lenders' consent, Permitted Acquired Indebtedness, daylight exposures, local working capital/overdrafts (up to £5,000,000 or 13.5% of Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA), Shareholder Loans, earn-out/deferred consideration, vendor loans (subordinated), insurance premiums/take-or-pay obligations, worker's compensation/social security, deferred compensation, unfunded pension obligations, Development Project Indebtedness, uncalled commitments.

prepayment_from_asset_sales_proceeds_cla.value: The Obligors’ Agent shall ensure that an amount equal to any Disposal Proceeds, 25% of any Specified Asset Disposal Proceeds, 50% of any Third Party IDP Net Cash Disposal Proceeds, any Insurance Proceeds, and any Recovery Proceeds is applied in prepayment of the Facilities.

percent_of_net_cash_proceeds.value: Disposal Proceeds: 100%. Specified Asset Disposal Proceeds: 25%. Third Party IDP Net Cash Disposal Proceeds: 50%. Insurance Proceeds: 100%. Recovery Proceeds: 100%.

permitted_reinvestment_period.value: 12 months of receipt (or 18 months if committed) for Excluded Disposal Proceeds, Excluded Insurance Proceeds, and Excluded Recovery Proceeds.

equity_cure_provision.value: No Event of Default will occur under financial covenants if, by no later than 20 Business Days after the date on which the Compliance Certificate for the Relevant Period in which such failure to comply was first evidenced is required to be delivered, the Group has received the proceeds of any New Shareholder Injections in cash. The 'Cure Amount' can be included by increasing Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA (EBITDA Cure) or decreasing Consolidated Total Net Debt (Net Debt Cure) to ensure covenant compliance.

number_of_equity_cures.value: Not more than four Equity Cures may be exercised in total. Not more than one EBITDA Cure may be exercised from the Closing Date. Not in consecutive Financial Quarters.

subsidiary_guarantees.value: The Company shall ensure that at all times commencing 120 days after the Closing Date, the aggregate EBITDA of Guarantors represents not less than 80% of Consolidated EBITDA of Group members incorporated in a Security Jurisdiction ('Guarantor Coverage Test'). Exclusions apply for negative EBITDA entities, unlawful guarantees, Regulated Group Companies, and general partners of funds.

transfer_provisions.value: Lenders may assign or Transfer (including by novation) rights and obligations to a New Lender, subject to conditions including Obligors’ Agent consent (unless exceptions apply) and minimum amounts. Restrictions on transfer to Industry Competitors, private equity sponsors, distressed investors, or persons similar to Group business. Debt Purchase Transactions by Group members or Sponsor Affiliates are subject to specific solicitation or open order processes. Certain transfers must comply with Intercreditor Agreement accession.

amendment_clause.value: Subject to the Intercreditor Agreement and specific exceptions, any term of the Finance Documents (other than Fee Letters) may be amended or waived only with the consent of the Majority Lenders and the Company. Certain changes require all Lenders (e.g., Change of Control definition, ranking senior to Facilities, Agent/Backstop Lender/Ancillary Lender/Hedge Counterparty specific rights, change of Parent/Borrowers/Guarantors). Structural Adjustments require consent of participating Lenders (and Majority Lenders if increasing commitments or reducing tenor). Specific consent from Majority RCF Lenders or Majority Super Senior Lenders for certain provisions.

snooze_lose_clause.value: If a Lender does not accept or reject a request for consent/agreement/waiver within 10 Business Days (or 5 for Defaulting Lender) of request ('Exclusion Date'), or fails to assist with prepayment/replacement steps within 3 Business Days, that Lender ('Excluded Lender') is automatically excluded from participating in that vote, and its participations, Commitments and vote are not included when ascertaining required approvals.

disqualified_lender_list.value: The document does not refer to a specific 'disqualified lender list'. However, Clause 27.3(b)(D) restricts transfers to 'an Industry Competitor, private equity sponsor (but excluding any independent debt fund whose principal business is investing in performing debt and which is an Affiliate of a private equity sponsor), or a loan to own/distressed investor' or 'a person whose business is similar or related to the Group’s business'.

events_of_default.value: Events of Default include: Payment Default, Financial covenants and other obligations breaches (with cure periods), Other obligations breaches (with cure periods), Misrepresentation (with cure periods), Cross default (threshold £2,700,000 or 7.5% of Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA), Insolvency, Insolvency proceedings, Creditors’ process (£2,700,000 or 7.5% of Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA), Similar Events, Unlawfulness and invalidity (with cure periods), Intercreditor Agreement and other Finance Documents breaches (with cure periods), Cessation of business, Expropriation, Repudiation and rescission of agreements, Litigation.

payment_default_provision.value: An Obligor does not pay on the due date any amount payable pursuant to a Finance Document unless such failure to pay is caused by administrative or technical error and: (a) in the case of principal and interest, payment is made within 3 Business Days of its due date; or (b) in the case of any other amount, payment is made within 5 Business Days of its due date.

insolvency_default.value: A Material Subsidiary or the Parent: (i) is unable or admits in writing its inability to pay its debts as they fall due (other than solely as a result of balance sheet liabilities exceeding assets); (ii) ceases or suspends making payments on its debt generally or publicly announces an intention to do so; (iii) is deemed to, or is declared to, be unable to pay its debts under applicable law; or (iv) by reason of actual or anticipated financial difficulties commences negotiations with its financial creditors generally (other than Finance Parties) with a view to a general rescheduling of its indebtedness. A moratorium is declared in respect of any indebtedness of any Material Subsidiary of the Parent.

misrepresentation_default.value: Any representation or statement made or deemed to be made by an Obligor or the Parent in the Finance Documents or any other document delivered is or proves to have been incorrect or misleading when made or deemed to be made. No Event of Default if capable of remedy and remedied within 20 Business Days of awareness or notice from Agent.

market_disruption_clause.value: Clause 14.2 (Market disruption) details an event (e.g., EURIBOR not supplied by Reference Banks, or funding cost in excess of EURIBOR) that affects interest calculation, not an Event of Default leading to acceleration. If a Market Disruption Event occurs, an alternative basis for interest may be agreed upon. No explicit Market Disruption Event of Default.

cross_default.value: Any Financial Indebtedness of any Material Subsidiary is not paid when due (or within grace period), or is declared/becomes due and payable prior to maturity due to a default, or any creditor becomes entitled to declare it due and payable. Threshold: less than £2,700,000 or 7.5% of Consolidated Pro Forma EBITDA. Excludes Hedging Agreements and intra-Group Financial Indebtedness.

cross_acceleration.value: Covered within Clause 26.5 (Cross default), where Financial Indebtedness of any Material Subsidiary being 'declared to be or otherwise becomes due and payable prior to its specified maturity as a result of an event of default' or a creditor becoming 'entitled to declare any Financial Indebtedness...due and payable prior to its specified maturity' constitutes an Event of Default.

no_set_off.value: Clause 33.7 states: 'All payments to be made by the Parent or an Obligor under the Finance Documents shall be calculated and be made without (and free and clear of any deduction for) set off or counterclaim.' However, Clause 34 (Set Off) permits a Finance Party to set off matured obligations during a Declared Default.

set_off_prohibited_for_borrower.value: Yes, all payments to be made by the Parent or an Obligor under the Finance Documents shall be calculated and be made without (and free and clear of any deduction for) set off or counterclaim.

bilateral_or_syndicated.value: Syndicated, with provisions for bilateral Ancillary Facilities.

business_days_convention_calendar.value: A day (other than a Saturday or Sunday) on which banks are open for general business in London (United Kingdom) and Guernsey. Specific conventions apply for payments/purchases of Euro (TARGET Day), and for fixing interest rates related to Term Rate Loans or Compounded Rate Loans (Additional Business Day). Schedule 14 details specific Business Day conventions for Sterling and US Dollars.

business_days_payments_non_business_day_.value: Any payment under any Finance Document which is due to be made on a day that is not a Business Day shall be made on the next Business Day in the same calendar month (if there is one) or the preceding Business Day (if there is not).

business_days_rate_setting_quotation_day.value: For Euro: two TARGET Days before the first day of that period. For Sterling: the first day of that period. For any other currency: two Business Days before the first day of that period, unless market practice differs. For US$: two Additional Business Days before the first day of the relevant Interest Period (unless market practice differs).

confidentiality_clause.value: Each Finance Party agrees to keep all Confidential Information confidential and not to disclose it to anyone, save to the extent permitted by specific disclosure provisions (e.g., to affiliates, potential assignees, for legal/regulatory requirements, or with Obligors' Agent consent). Specific rules for numbering service providers.

language_for_client_communication.value: Any notice given under or in connection with any Finance Document must be in English. All other documents provided must be in English, or if not, accompanied by a certified English translation (English translation prevails unless document is constitutional/statutory/official).

SCHEDULE 10 
AGREED SECURITY PRINCIPLES 
For the purposes of this Schedule 10, the term “Obligor” shall be deemed to include the Parent, 
provided that nothing herein shall require the Parent to grant any Security in addition to that 
which it has granted prior to the Closing Date unless specifically required by another clause or 
section of this Agreement. 
1. 
Considerations 
(a) 
In determining what guarantees and Security will be provided in support of the 
Facilities and all the rights and obligations associated with such giving or taking 
of guarantees and Security the following matters will be taken into account.  
Guarantees and Security (including pursuant to Clause 25.27 (Further 
assurance)) shall not be created or perfected to the extent that it would: 
(i) 
result in any breach of applicable general law and statutory limitations, 
regulations applicable to the business of the Group or the Group in 
general or in respect of a specific part of the business or specific 
members of the Group (as the case may be), corporate benefit, capital 
maintenance, financial assistance, fraudulent preference, retention of 
title claims or thin capitalisation, “earnings stripping”, “controlled 
foreign corporation” or “capital maintenance” laws or regulations (or 
analogous restrictions) of any applicable jurisdiction; 
(ii) 
result in a significant risk to the officers of the relevant grantor of the 
guarantee and Security of contravention of their fiduciary duties or 
contravene any legal prohibition and/or of civil or criminal liability; or 
(iii) 
result in material incremental costs that are disproportionate to the 
benefit obtained by the beneficiaries of that guarantee and Security. 
(b) 
Parties shall take into account any existing bona fide third party arrangements 
which are not prohibited by this Agreement and which prevent assets from being 
subject to Security and such assets will be excluded from any relevant Security 
document provided that all reasonable endeavours to obtain consent to subject 
any such assets to Transaction Security shall be used by the relevant Obligor if 
the relevant asset is material. 
(c) 
Certain supervisory board, works council or other external body’s consent or 
advice (as applicable) may be required to enable a member of the Group to 
provide a guarantee or Security; such guarantee and/or Security shall not be 
provided until such consent or advice (as applicable) has been received 
provided that reasonable endeavours have been used by the relevant member 
of the Group to obtain the relevant consent or advice (as applicable) to the extent 
reasonably practicable and permissible by law, regulation and custom. 
(d) 
In these Agreed Security Principles, cost is limited to, income tax cost, 
notarisation, registration taxes payable on the creation or enforcement or for the 
continuance of any guarantee and Security, stamp duties, out-of-pocket 
expenses, and other fees and expenses directly incurred by the relevant grantor
pages.355:
- 351 - 
 
 
of the guarantee and Security or any of its direct or indirect owners, Subsidiaries 
or Affiliates. 
(e) 
“Enforcement Event” means the occurrence of a Declared Default. 
2. 
General 
(a) 
Where there is material incremental cost involved in creating Security the 
principle stated at paragraph (iii) of paragraph 1 (Considerations) above shall 
apply and, subject to these Agreed Security Principles, a cost/benefit-analysis 
will be made by the Agent (acting reasonably and in consultation with the Parent) 
in determining whether or not such asset shall be subject to Security. 
(b) 
To the extent possible under applicable laws: 
(i) 
the Security shall be enforceable on and from an Enforcement Event 
occurring; 
(ii) 
the Security will be first ranking, to the extent possible and subject to 
any Security interest over the relevant asset which is expressly permitted 
by the terms of this Agreement and which is already expressed to be first 
ranking; and 
(iii) 
to the extent possible and subject to any other legal requirement, the 
documentation in respect of any Security granted by the Additional 
Obligors shall mirror the documentation in respect of the Security 
granted by the Original Obligors. 
(c) 
The granting of guarantees, perfection of Security, when required, and other 
legal formalities will be completed as soon as practicable and, in any event, 
within the time periods specified in the relevant Finance Documents or (if 
earlier or to the extent no such time periods are specified in the Finance 
Documents) within the time periods specified by applicable law in order to 
ensure due perfection. 
(d) 
The provisions of each Transaction Security Document will not be unduly 
burdensome on the Obligor or provider of that Security (in the case of Security 
over shares) or interfere materially with the operation of its business (other than 
any Transaction Security Document over Shareholder Loans which, for the 
avoidance of doubt, shall be perfected) and will be limited to those required to 
create effective Security and not impose commercial obligations provided that 
the Parent and each relevant member of the Group that has created Security over 
its receivables shall use commercially reasonable endeavours to ensure that any 
contract entered into by it does not contain provisions that restrict or prejudice 
the effectiveness of that receivables Security or its enforcement. 
(e) 
Information, such as lists of assets, will be provided only if mandatorily required 
under applicable law. 
(f) 
There shall be no rights for Secured Parties to exercise a power of attorney until 
the occurrence of an Enforcement Event or failure by the relevant Obligor to

- 352 - 
 
 
perform a further assurance, registration or perfection obligation under or 
relating to a Finance Document within 10 Business Days of written notice by 
the Security Agent. 
(g) 
To the extent possible, all Transaction Security shall be granted in favour of the 
Security Agent acting on behalf of the Finance Parties individually and, if 
customary in the relevant jurisdiction, in favour of the Finance Parties 
represented by the Security Agent or each Lender from time to time (as relevant).  
“Trust”, “parallel debt” or “joint and several creditorship” provisions will be 
used where necessary; such provisions will be contained in the Intercreditor 
Agreement unless required otherwise under applicable laws.  To the extent 
possible, no action shall be required in relation to the guarantees or Security 
when any Lender transfers any of its participation in the Facilities to a new 
Lender.  If any action is required upon a transfer of participation, the transferring 
Lender will bear all related costs and expenses (including stamp duties, taxes, 
registration costs). 
(h) 
Transaction Security, will where possible and practical, automatically create 
Security over future assets of the same type as those already secured.  Where 
local law requires supplemental pledges to be delivered in respect of future 
acquired assets in order for effective Security to be created over that class of 
assets, supplemental pledges shall be provided no more frequently than annually 
(unless expressly required more frequently under local law). 
(i) 
Transaction Security Documents will not accrue interest on any amount in 
respect of which interest is accruing under this Agreement. 
(j) 
No Transaction Security will be granted over any trade receivables which 
cannot be secured under the terms of the relevant contract provided that such 
contract is entered into in the ordinary course of business on arm’s length terms 
with a bona fide third party. 
(k) 
Where an Obligor acquires assets of material value or significance for the 
business of the Group after the date on which it initially grants Security, such 
Obligor shall (unless existing Transaction Security automatically creates valid 
Security over such assets) enter into security arrangements in accordance with 
these Agreed Security Principles in respect of such assets if they are of a type 
which, if owned at the date of this Agreement, would have been secured in 
accordance with these Agreed Security Principles. 
(l) 
Notwithstanding any other provision of any Finance Document: 
(i) 
(other than any floating charge granted under an English law, or an Irish 
law, governed global security document (and, for the avoidance of doubt, 
any customary excluded assets consistent with these Agreed Security 
Principles shall not be subject to such floating charge) and any security 
granted pursuant to a New York law governed general security 
agreement) the Transaction Security shall be limited to customary 
Security over shares in Obligors and Material Subsidiaries which are 
(subject to these Agreed Security Principles) required to accede as

Guarantors, material intra-Group receivables owed to Obligors and 
material bank accounts; and 
(ii) 
no Security shall be granted by or over any Excluded Entity.  
(m) 
Security shall not be granted by or over a member of the Group where that 
member of the Group is a Regulated Group Company or is prohibited from 
granting Security pursuant to the Regulatory Restrictions or is a general partner 
of a fund. For the avoidance of doubt, this paragraph (m) shall not exclude the 
grant of any other Security by Holding Companies of Regulated Group 
Companies or general partners of funds.  
(n) 
The guarantees and Security to be provided in support of the Facilities in 
accordance with these Agreed Security Principles are only to be given by 
members of the Group which are incorporated in a Security Jurisdiction and not 
in any other jurisdiction, and (in respect of Security granted by the Parent under 
the Transaction Security Documents provided pursuant to paragraph 3(a) of 
Part A (Conditions Precedent to Signing the Agreement) of Schedule 2

Subsequent) only) the Parent. 
(o) 
No guarantees shall be required to be given by and no Security shall be required 
to be given by (or over shares, ownership interests or investments in) any person 
incorporated in a jurisdiction other than a Security Jurisdiction. 
3. 
Shares 
(a) 
Security over shares will be provided in accordance with Part A (Conditions 
Precedent to Signing the Agreement) of Schedule 2 (Conditions Precedent) in 
respect of shares held in Obligors only. 
(b) 
Until an Enforcement Event the company providing the relevant Security will 
be permitted to retain and to exercise voting rights appertaining to any shares 
charged by it. 
(c) 
The Security Agent may only exercise the voting rights provided that: 
(i) 
an Enforcement Event has occurred; and 
(ii) 
the Security Agent notifies the provider of the relevant share Security 
and the company whose shares are subject to the relevant share Security 
that it seeks to exercise those voting rights. 
(d) 
Until an Enforcement Event the company whose shares are subject to that 
Security will be permitted to pay dividends upstream in respect of its shares to 
the extent permitted under the Finance Documents. 
(e) 
Where customary the share certificates (or other documents evidencing title to 
the relevant shares) duly endorsed in blank together with, as applicable, a stock 
transfer form executed in blank and (if required under local law) a copy of the

share register where the Security has been registered will be provided to the 
Security Agent. 
4. 
Intercompany receivables (other than Shareholder Loans) 
(a) 
Notification of Security over intercompany receivables (other than Shareholder 
Loans) will be delivered within five Business Days of the Security being granted 
and the Obligor shall procure that acknowledgement is obtained within 20 
Business Days of service.   
(b) 
Until an Enforcement Event the Obligor providing the Security is permitted to 
receive any payment under its intercompany receivables to the extent permitted 
under the Finance Documents. 
(c) 
No intercompany receivables shall be evidenced by a negotiable instrument. 
5. 
Shareholder Loans 
(a) 
Security over the principal element of Shareholder Loans shall be perfected. 
(b) 
Notification of Security over Shareholder Loans will be delivered on the date of 
the security being granted and the Parent shall procure that acknowledgement 
is obtained on the same day. 
(c) 
Without prejudice to any payments or transactions, in each case, permitted

under the Finance Documents. 
(d) 
Copies of loan documents evidencing Shareholder Loans shall be delivered to 
the Security Agent within the timeframes set out in the relevant Transaction 
Security Document and no Shareholder Loan shall be evidenced by a negotiable 
instrument.

Bank accounts (including bank account receivables) 
(a) 
Until an Enforcement Event or as expressly agreed otherwise (for example in 
relation to an account used for cash cover purpose) the Obligor providing the 
Security is permitted to withdraw and transfer monies from the accounts to the 
extent permitted or not expressly restricted under the Finance Documents. 
(b) 
If required by or customary under local law to perfect the Security, notice of the 
Security will be served on the account bank within five Business Days of the 
Security being granted and the Obligor shall use its reasonable endeavours (not 
involving the payment of money or incurrence of any external expenses) to 
obtain an acknowledgement of that within 20 Business Days of service. 
(c) 
Any obligation on the Obligor to use such reasonable endeavours to obtain an 
acknowledgement from such bank of the notification shall cease on the expiry 
of the above mentioned 20 Business Days period.

Any Security over bank accounts shall be subject to any prior Security interests

Undertakings/Representations and Warranties 
(a) 
The Transaction Security Documents shall not operate so as to prevent 
transactions which are permitted under this Agreement and shall not require 
additional consents or authorisations unless such is required or customary under 
applicable laws. 
(b) 
The Transaction Security Documents will contain the market standard 
representations, warranties or undertakings and to the extent possible under 
applicable laws shall mirror the representations, warranties or undertakings as 
included in the Transaction Security Documents of the Original Obligors.  
Unless required by applicable law, the representations, warranties or 
undertakings or other provisions contained in this Agreement or the 
Intercreditor Agreement shall not be covered or duplicated in any Transaction 
Security Document, unless required under applicable laws to perfect Security 
that pursuant to these Agreed Security Principles shall be perfected.

(a)

(b)
